G.T.6205
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 6th NOVEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
East of the FORET DE MORMAL our troops have reached the BAVAI - PONT road for a distance of 6,000 yards north of the SAMBRE?, and south of BER?AIMONT have succeeded in crossing this river.
Heavy rain is making progress slow. The total number of prisoners captured since the morning of 4th November is 11,000.
French Front.
South of the OISE the First Army continues to make progress, and has reached the following line :- CHEVENNES, south of MARFONTAINE, VOHARIES, THIERNU, east of MONTIGNY, CILLY, east of LA NEUVILLE, east of EBOUTEAU, BUCY.
Further east the line runs north of DIZY-LE-GROS, south of LE THEUL, west of WALEPPE, southern outskirts of HANNOGNE, south-west of SERAINCOURT, east of CHAUDION, ECLY, BARBY.
The Fourth French Army has crossed the ARDENNES CANAL between NEUVILLE-et-DAY LE CHESNE and has advanced as far as LOUVERCNY? and SAUVILLE.
From SAUVILLE the First American Army is on the following line :- south of LE MONT DIEU, STONNE, LE BESACE, YONCQ, west bank of the MEUSE, north of LETAHNE.
2. There is nothing to report from any other front.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
6th November, 1918.
Issued at 12.40 p.m.
